title: Is July 9th letter Tamala Krishna Goswami’s? | Sri Suvyakta Narasimha Dasa
speaker: HG Suvyakta Narasimha Dasa

segments.key_quote: Srila Prabhupada, on 9th of July, 1977, issued a written directive to the whole of ISKCON, detailing a Rithvik system of initiations to be followed in ISKCON.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the July 9th Directive, explaining its context and purpose regarding the Rithvik system of initiations.
segments.transcript: Hare Krishna! Vishwaguru Srila Prabhupada ki Jai! Srila Prabhupada, on 9th of July, 1977, issued a written directive to the whole of ISKCON, detailing a Rithvik system of initiations to be followed in ISKCON. In this directive, Srila Prabhupada appointed 11 devotees to act as his representatives, also called Rithviks, to initiate disciples on his behalf. The newly initiated disciples would be Srila Prabhupada's disciples. This directive, July 9th directive, was actually the outcome of a GBC meeting with Srila Prabhupada on 28th of May, 1977, where they asked Srila Prabhupada what would be the system of conducting initiations in ISKCON, particularly at the time when Prabhupada was no longer with us. Tamalkrishna Goswami, who was Srila Prabhupada's secretary at that time, typed out the directive on July 9th, 1977, and he took Prabhupada's signature on it, and he sent it out to all the GBCs and temple presidents at that time.

segments.key_quote: Tamalkrishna Goswami claimed that the July 9th letter was his letter, not Srila Prabhupada's.
segments.summary: The speaker discusses Tamal Krishna Goswami's later claim that he authored the July 9th letter and the implications for the current Guru system in ISKCON.
